title: 'Saigon on Steroids': The Desperate Rush to Flee Afghanistan
summary: Resume Subscription. KABUL-The lucky few were already inside, crowded onto the last patch of government territory that hadn't fallen to the Taliban. Outside, as thousands of civilians surged to break through the perimeter of Hamid Karzai International Airport, security forces fired gunshots into the air to force them back.

title: Hyatt Plans to Buy Apple Leisure Group From KKR and KSL Capital for $2.7 Billion
summary: Transaction is latest sign of optimism about return to vacation travel. Hyatt Hotels Corp. plans to buy resort company Apple Leisure Group from its private-equity owners for $2.7 billion.

title: Haiti Earthquake Death Toll Rises to More Than 1,200
summary: Resume Subscription. At least 1,297 people were killed and some 5,700 injured in a devastating earthquake that struck Haiti this weekend, aggravating the crisis of an increasingly chaotic country whose president was assassinated last month and where a coming tropical storm threatens even more devastation.

title: Chaotic Afghanistan Pullout Caps Two Decades of Missteps
summary: Successive U.S. administrations followed strategies that inadvertently fueled support for the insurgency and missed key windows to negotiate. WASHINGTON-In early July, President Biden stood in the East Room of the White House and bristled at the suggestion that the Afghanistan War would end in the same ignominious manner as the war in Vietnam.

title: Afghanistan Takeover by Taliban Worries Governments in the Region, Europe That Chaos Will Spread
summary: Pakistan and Iran are among countries most vulnerable to a wave of refugees, but European governments are also raising concerns. The collapse of the Afghan government and takeover of the country by the Taliban is stirring concern in foreign capitals that chaos and instability engulfing the country could spill over to its neighbors and possibly drive a tide of refugees as far as Europe.

title: Afghanistan's Collapse Creates Hurdles for U.S., Allies
summary: Monitoring terrorist groups, protecting women's gains and preventing Taliban from taking possession of U.S. military equipment are among challenges. WASHINGTON-While Biden administration officials sought to cast blame on the Trump administration and Afghan forces for the fall of Kabul, the withdrawal of U.S. troops is creating a set of new problems that will now be even harder to manage.

title: Taliban Seize Power in Afghanistan
summary: President Ashraf Ghani flees abroad as insurgents' advance intensifies Western evacuation efforts. KABUL-Taliban fighters on Sunday took over the Afghan capital and President Ashraf Ghani fled abroad, leaving the government in collapse, as a U.S.-led military operation began to airlift Western diplomats, civilians and Afghans likely to be targeted by the country's new rulers.

title: 'DSM' Review: The Meanings of Madness
summary: The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, or DSM, features nearly 300 diagnoses. What's the science behind it?. Among the many costs of the pandemic lockdowns and school closures, as both proponents and opponents of these measures agree, is an upsurge in reported cases of mental illness. But underneath this consensus lurks uncertainty about what's meant by "mental illness." If there really is a mental-health crisis, then doctors-psychiatrists-should have a lead role in responding to it. Rutgers sociologist Allan V. Horwitz's history of the "Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders," or DSM-the medical field's definitive classification of mental disorders-explores psychiatry's claim to such authority.

title: Biden's Afghanistan Surrender
summary: The President tries to duck responsibility for a calamitous withdrawal.. President Biden's statement on Saturday washing his hands of Afghanistan deserves to go down as one of the most shameful in history by a Commander in Chief at such a moment of American retreat. As the Taliban closed in on Kabul, Mr. Biden sent a confirmation of U.S. abandonment that absolved himself of responsibility, deflected blame to his predecessor, and more or less invited the Taliban to take over the country.

title: Nancy Pelosi on Afghan Women
summary: The House Speaker has a stern feminist warning for the Taliban.. Politics often requires blind loyalty, and on Afghanistan the word blind clearly applies to Nancy Pelosi. On Sunday the House Speaker issued a statement that began, "The President is to be commended for the clarity of purpose of his statement on Afghanistan and the actions he has taken."

title: The Afghan Allies Left Behind
summary: Fear and chaos in Kabul as the U.S. fails to get loyal friends out.. President Ashraf Ghani was able to flee Afghanistan on Sunday, preventing the spectacle of a public execution by the Taliban. But tens of thousands of other Afghans who assisted the U.S. over 20 years aren't so fortunate and now face a potentially gruesome fate.

title: Biden's Afghanistan Exit Raises Questions About His Foreign-Policy Record
summary: U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan could create a haven for terrorist groups, experts warn. During the 2020 political campaign, President Biden presented himself as a globe-trotting leader who had helmed the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, served as President Barack Obama's point man on complex international issues and who was determined to bring a steady hand to national security.

title: Intelligence Reports From Afghanistan Missed One Key Element: Speed
summary: U.S. officials are conflicted over whether intelligence failures may have contributed to the swift Taliban takeover of Afghanistan. In late June, a stark new intelligence estimate said the government of President Ashraf Ghani could collapse in as soon as six months after the U.S. withdrew its troops from Afghanistan.

title: Roger Federer Out of U.S. Open After Knee Setback
summary: The 20-time Grand Slam winner will undergo his third surgery since early 2020, ruling him out indefinitely. The end of Roger Federer's glittering career appeared to draw nearer on Sunday as he announced that he would undergo his third knee surgery since 2020, ruling him out of the upcoming U.S. Open and other competition for months to come.

title: The World Needs to Know What Happened at the Wuhan Lab
summary: Was the coronavirus manipulated to infect humans? If so, that will inform our response.. The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention wasn't allowed to visit the city of Wuhan, China, or the Wuhan Institute of Virology in early 2020. We've been trying to find out why ever since. Had we encountered transparency rather than stonewalling, it wouldn't have been necessary to put together the circumstantial pieces of the puzzle on our own.

title: Democrats Put Taxpayers Behind the 8-Ball
summary: 'Outlook not so good' if you have a retirement account, capital gains or assets for inheritance.. The Biden American Families Plan envisions a dystopia for upper-income taxpayers. But what are the odds it will be enacted? The election was decided by the narrowest of margins, and the bill will receive no support from Republicans. Vice President Kamala Harris will need to cast the deciding vote in a 50-50 Senate. The need to herd 50 Democrats should moderate the tax measures that President Biden has proposed.

title: Biden Is Failing Cuba's Uprising
summary: The White House is so far unwilling to challenge the U.S. left that likes the regime.. It's been five weeks since thousands across Cuba joined unprecedented protests against the 62-year-old communist regime. Yet Team Biden is still having trouble delineating a policy that actively supports the popular cry for self-governance. It's enough to make one wonder if regime change is an administration priority.

title: Big Tech Acts Like Big Brother
summary: YouTube censored my news conference as 'misinformation.'. The notice came in white text on a dark screen: "This video has been removed for violating YouTube's Community Guidelines." The company last week blocked a 45-minute video of my news conference announcing a lawsuit challenging Mayor Bill de Blasio's "vaccine passport" as an invasion of New Yorkers' privacy and an unreasonable mandate on small businesses.

title: Economy Week Ahead: Retail Sales, Industrial Output, Fed Minutes
summary: Markets this week will focus on U.S. retail sales and minutes from the Federal Reserve's July policy meeting. Markets this week will focus on U.S. retail sales and minutes from the Federal Reserve's July 27-28 policy meeting.

title: The Delta Variant Is Already Leaving Its Mark on Business
summary: Resume Subscription. Repercussions from the Delta variant of Covid-19 are starting to ripple across companies, raising staffing costs in senior housing, disrupting production of potato chips and leading some companies to rein in profit projections.

title: In Afghanistan, the Tragic Toll of Washington Delusion
summary: Pundits repeat the mantra that there was 'no military solution.' The Taliban seem to have come up with one.. The world is witnessing in Afghanistan a vivid and painful display of what happens when leaders in Washington delude themselves regarding persistent threats, the nature of America's enemies and the ability to end wars by simply going home.

title: A Chinese Warning for U.S. Tech
summary: Washington may follow Beijing's crackdown, and CEOs need to act now to slow the regulatory rush.. Big U.S. tech companies must be watching with glee as China cracks down on its homegrown technology companies. They are thrilled not only because they are seeing potential global competitors in e-commerce, music licensing, ride sharing, food delivery and more weakened, but because they now have a powerful card to play at home.

title: The Covid Fear Isn't Going Anywhere for a While
summary: The key is to first recognize your anxiety, and then find ways to deal with it. Of the roller coaster of emotions experienced during the pandemic, the most pervasive and persistent has been fear. We have feared for ourselves, our loved ones and our way of life. We may have manifested this fear differently-from outright denial to suiting up in rubber gloves and face shields-but still, these are anxious times.

title: Canada to Hold Snap Vote, as Justin Trudeau Seeks to Advance Agenda
summary: Prime minister aims to capitalize on support for his pandemic response and secure parliamentary backing for child-care, climate-change policies. OTTAWA-Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau called an early national election for next month, looking to capitalize on popular support for his government's efforts to combat the Covid-19 pandemic and secure a third term in power.

title: Climate Change and Revealed Preferences
summary: Lawmakers won't compromise for a carbon tax, and Obama buys a $12 million home by the ocean.. Your editorial "A Climate of Catastrophe" (Aug. 10) argues that the newest Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change climate report isn't as disturbing as one might imagine. You note the report's estimate of likely climate-sensitivity range: 2.5 to 4 degrees Celsius higher than in the late 1800s, to be compared with a corresponding range reported in the IPCC's 2013 report: 1.5 to 4.5 degrees Celsius. You say the top end has been moderated, but I'd add that the bottom end has been shortened. A temperature rise as low as between 1.5 and 2.5 degrees is now in the unlikely range, per the IPCC. That's very significant. The center of the likely range rises. The new IPCC report is not to be taken lightly.

title: New Anti-Semitism Treats Israel as 'the Jew Among the Nations'
summary: It's more than a hatred like all the others.. As much as I respect Israeli Foreign Minister Yair Lapid, I must write in support of Prof. Ruth Wisse's analysis of the disease we call antisemitism. Yes, antisemitism is a hatred like so many hatreds, but after combatting it for more than 50 years, I can assure you it is also, sadly, unique ("Anti-Semitism Isn't Merely Another Kind of Hate," op-ed, Aug. 9).

title: Raising Taxes to Fund the Liberal Wish List
summary: The infrastructure deal will cause the federal government to collect almost $50 billion more in revenue.. Your editorial "So Much for 'Fully Paid For'" (Aug. 7) rightly pans the infrastructure deal as "fiscal flim-flam." It also tries to give Republicans who support the bill some credit: "At least you didn't raise taxes." But the Congressional Budget Office's report reveals even that is not totally accurate.

title: Resigning Protects Gov. Cuomo From Legal Trouble
summary: Impeachment proceedings would produce evidence that can be used against him in civil and criminal actions.. Regarding "Cuomo Should Have Made Albany Vote" (Review & Outlook, Aug. 11): My guess is Gov. Andrew Cuomo's lawyers told him that impeachment proceedings would produce evidence that can be used against him in civil and criminal actions. If he was expected to survive impeachment, the risk might be worth taking. But with removal from office perceived as likely, it made no sense to go through impeachment only to weaken his legal position later.

title: China Bullies Taiwan, Not Sweden
summary: Banned Huawei led to a reciprocal response from Beijing.. Elisabeth Braw's op-ed "How Do You Stop Beijing From Bullying? Take Away Its Prada Bags" (Aug. 11) selects a poor example for its thesis that Beijing is a bully. Sweden banned Huawei from its telecom infrastructure, which led to a reciprocal response from the Chinese government. Better examples are China's actions intended to advance its goal of taking over Taiwan.

title: Once a Hoarder, the Container Store's New Chief Has Hope for You, Too
summary: Most Popular News. Satish Malhotra had shopped at the Container Store just once, a decade ago, before he was picked to run it. A self-described hoarder, the former Sephora operating chief says he wasn't particularly organized.

title: PSG's Messi Situation: What to Do With All These Superstars?
summary: The French club has turned itself into a superteam, but no clear blueprint exists for blending Messi, Neymar, and Mbappé.. PARIS-The Lionel Messi unveiling party here had lasted nearly a week by the time his new club, Paris Saint-Germain, kicked a live ball. There had been photo opportunities, a few training sessions, and a lot of papal waving from open windows to the adoring masses below.

title: Fuel Explosion in Lebanon Kills 28
summary: With the country in economic collapse, tank explodes as people tried to collect gasoline. A warehouse containing illegally stored fuel exploded in northern Lebanon early Sunday, killing 28 people and injuring dozens, as the Mediterranean nation grapples with a severe fuel crisis during an economic collapse.

title: U.S. Economy Likely to Outgrow China's in Short Term
summary: A faster short-term U.S. expansion would delay the day when China's economy overtakes America's in size. The U.S. and China are trading places in the economic growth race.

title: Something Is Awry in the Treasury Market This Summer
summary: Bond yields fell too far, then came back too strong; a real yield of minus 1.2% is hard to understand. I get uncomfortable when I can't understand what's going on in the markets, and I'm not really happy with my explanation for the weirdness of the Treasury market over the past few months. Given that pretty much everything else rests on Treasurys behaving sensibly, my level of discomfort is high.

title: The Guns That Won World War II
summary: Before wielding the atomic bomb, the U.S. subdued Japan's forces across the Pacific with weapons designed by an inventor who died two decades earlier. From March 1945 until the end of World War II, the skies over Japan witnessed some of the deadliest aerial raids in history. Fleets of B-29 bombers, the four-engine "Superfortress" that represented the pinnacle of American aeronautical achievement, firebombed Tokyo and virtually all of Japan's major cities. The air campaign culminated in the use of another unique American invention, the atomic bomb, and 76 years ago, on Aug. 14, 1945, Imperial Japan surrendered.

title: Shale Pioneer Chesapeake Touts Natural Gas Again
summary: Company has agreed to purchase Vine Energy, positioning itself for the export market. Chesapeake Energy Corp. , a fracking pioneer, is once again betting big on natural gas after recently emerging from bankruptcy, agreeing last week to buy another gas company to position itself to sell the commodity in Europe and Asia.

title: Florida Nursing Homes Limit Visitors as Covid-19 Cases Flare
summary: Long-term-care facilities in some hot-spot states curtail visitation, group activities. MIAMI-Nursing homes in Florida and other Covid-19 hot spots are once again tightening restrictions on visitation and group activities in response to recent rises in Covid-19 cases.

title: Homeland Security Weighs Using Outside Firms to Analyze Social Media
summary: Effort has spurred civil-rights debates at DHS and White House, would expand government's handling of social-media data. The Department of Homeland Security is considering hiring private companies to analyze public social media for warning signs of extremist violence, spurring debate within the agency over how to monitor for such threats while protecting Americans' civil liberties.

title: They Ditched the Office for the Farm. And Stayed.
summary: Resume Subscription. The origin story of the Dream Harvest Farming Co. sounds straight out of Silicon Valley.

title: Sleep Apnea Sufferers Scramble After Philips Recall of Critical Machine
summary: Prices soar for alternate devices and some users try a do-it-yourself fix after machines are found to emit potentially harmful gases, particles. Aaron Horton, a sleep apnea sufferer, stops breathing for brief periods hundreds of times every night. To keep his oxygen levels up, he uses a device made by Royal Philips NV that is now subject to a huge recall by the Dutch healthcare conglomerate. It warned in June that the machines could be sending potentially cancer-causing particles into users' airways.

title: China's Corporate Crackdown Adds to Junk-Bond Distress
summary: Government campaign to reduce debt in sectors such as real estate has put many developers in tight spot, sending high-yield bond prices tumbling. The latest Chinese market to buckle under pressure from Beijing's wide-ranging corporate crackdown: junk bonds.

title: Carvana's Success Rides on Used-Car Loans
summary: Selling sports cars and pickup trucks is only part of what makes the online dealer money. Online used-car dealer Carvana Co. , known for its vehicle vending-machine towers, has a secret sauce to its business success: a way of handling car loans that turbocharges revenue.

title: Restaurants Become the New Vaccine Enforcers
summary: Resume Subscription. Restaurant managers and hosts are being assigned a new job-vaccination police-and it's dividing businesses and customers.

title: Group Behind Some of Hong Kong's Biggest Protests to Disband
summary: Civil Human Rights Front joins other organizations that have folded under pressure from national-security law imposed by China. HONG KONG-The group that organized some of the biggest marches during Hong Kong's 2019 protests said it would disband, as the national-security law ensnares wider swaths of the city's civil society.

title: Vol. 34, No. 7: Multiple
summary: Most Popular News. At its best, The Wall Street Journal, like other publications, doesn't reach for a fancy or slanted word when a simple, direct one will do.

title: Why Many Millennials Fall Prey to Impostor Syndrome
summary: When young adults doubt their financial success-and knowledge-it can complicate decision making. "I don't know what I'm doing when it comes to managing my money."
